name: Dewitt Buckingham
tagline: I use cool things to make cool things
body:
# Howdy, I'm Dewitt

## I'm a web developer and designer. 

I have some formal education in software engineering but beyond that I am mostly self-taught. I've been playing around with websites since age 15 and software in general since way before that. I like to stay up-to-date on current web technologies and stanards. I'm constantly learning new ways of not only building sites and apps but improving on existing ones. Basically, I use cool things to make cool things.

While I'm a programmer at heart, I've heavily ventured into front-end design. Responsive and clean interfaces are what I strive for with my designs while my work on the back-end is geared towards performance and maintainability. Overall, I aim for simple and elegant solutions across the full stack.

**I am currently for hire for small- to medium-sized website and web app projects.**

If you would like to contact me, please feel free to [shoot me an email](mailto:captain@zerodaedalus.net). You can also [follow me on Twitter](https://twitter.com/ZeroDaedalus). I also  [accept PayPal donations](https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=AYVA292HL7LL6).

***


Here are some of the cool things that I use:  
* Pen and Paper
* Linux
* Node/npm
* jQuery
* Bootstrap
* Grunt
* Sass
* Jade
* Git
* WordPress

Technologies that I regularly work with:  
* HTML + CSS
* JavaScript
* PHP
* Bash/Shell Scripts
* MySQL
* NoSQL (MongoDB)
* Apache
* Nginx

# Projects
### [IFB](//staging.zerodaedalus.com/ifb) • [Repo](//github.com/dajoker29/food-bank-site)

The Interfaith Food Bank is an awesome non-profit organization in Stockton, California which provides other non-profits (such as churches, group homes, etc.) with foodstuffs and other supplies to be dispensed to the public. As a gift for their dedicated work in providing for the community, I designed a website to help them spread their message and allow them to easily accept more donations.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
